CatDescriptText: Mr. Robert King, porter, Homewood and Mr. Harry Harper, postal clerk, Fifth Ward, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, November 4, 1961, pg. 10  with question: "Do you think that there is any need for building bomb shelters?  If so, who should build them--the individual citizens or the Federal Government?" Mr. Robert King's answer reads: "Yes, and the Federal Government should build them, because they are suppose to look out for the people."  Mr. Harry Harper's answer reads: "No, I don't think bomb shelters are needed because if there's a nuclear attack, everything will be leveled by the bomb."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Robert King wearing light colored zippered jacket, standing on sidewalk with building and woman carrying umbrella in background; Portrait of Harry Harper wearing light colored zippered jacket, moustache, and eyeglasses, standing in front of buildings and man
